info.description: Webshop services connect Webshop applications to ERP system. The entry point of Webshop API is `/customers/{companyName}/{customerNr}`, which is called by Webshop application whenever a user logs in. If the customer requestedOrderPosition by its number could be found, the response contains a `_links` section, which contains all possible navigations and actions the customer can take.
info.title: Webshop Service API

tags.name: util
tags.description: The service endpoints of technical support.

tags.name: electronic delivery notes
tags.description: The electonic delivery notes related service endpoints.

tags.name: return
tags.description: Service endpoints related to return entities

get.description: Retrieves customer representation by customer number.

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: The company to which the webshop belongs, e.g. 'Derendinger-Switzerland'.

parameters.name: customerNr
parameters.description: The number of the customer.

200.description: Successful response if customer with the given number could be retreived in the context of the company.

400.description: If the provided company name is invalid, the service responds with a 400 (Bad Request) status.

404.description: If customer with given number does not exist, the service responds with a 404 (NotFound) status.

get.description: Retrieves creditlimit of given customer.

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: The company to which the webshop belongs, e.g. 'Derendinger-Switzerland'.

parameters.name: customerNr
parameters.description: The number of the customer.

200.description: Successful response if credit limit of customer with the given number could be retreived in the context of the company.

400.description: If the provided company name is invalid, the service responds with a 400 (Bad Request) status.

404.description: If customer with given number does not exist, the service responds with a 404 (NotFound) status.

get.description: Retrieves invoice and delivery addresses of the customer.

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: The company to which the webshop belongs, e.g. 'Derendinger-Switzerland'.

parameters.name: customerNr
parameters.description: Number of the customer resource.

parameters.name: street
parameters.description: Address street

parameters.name: postCode
parameters.description: Address post code

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: Address city

parameters.name: countryCode
parameters.description: Address country code

parameters.name: buildingCompliment
parameters.description: Address building compliment

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Address description

200.description: Successful response provides the list of addresses of the customer

400.description: If the provided company name is invalid, the service responds with a 400 (Bad Request) status.

404.description: If the customer has no addresses or customer does not exist, endpoint responds with a 404 (Not Found) status.

get.description: Retrieves particular address by its id.

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: The company to which the webshop belongs, e.g. 'Derendinger-Switzerland'.

parameters.name: customerNr
parameters.description: Number of the customer resource.

parameters.name: addressId
parameters.description: The id of the address resource.

200.description: Successful response provides the requested addresses.

400.description: If the provided company name is invalid, the service responds with a 400 (Bad Request) status.

404.description: If customer or address does not exist for given company, the request responds a 404 (NotFound) status.

get.description: Retrieves courier services

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: The company to which the webshop belongs, e.g. 'Derendinger-Switzerland'.

parameters.name: customerNr
parameters.description: Number of the customer resource.

parameters.name: addressId
parameters.description: The id of the address resource.

200.description: Successful response provides the requested courier services.

400.description: If the provided company name is invalid, the service responds with a 400 (Bad Request) status.

404.description: If customer or address does not exist for given company, the request responds a 404 (NotFound) status.

get.description: Retrieves representation of a list of articles, which are given by their ids.

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: The company to which the webshop belongs, e.g. 'Derendinger-Switzerland'.

parameters.name: articleIds
parameters.description: Query parameter containing comma-separated list of identifiers of articles. The article identifiers must be positive integer values consisting of max 10 digits.

200.description: Successful response provides a list of article representations.

400.description: If the provided company name is invalid, the list of article identifier is empty, or any article identifier does not conform to the identified rules, then the service responds with a 400 (Bad Request) status.

get.description: Retrieves representation of an article which is given by its id.

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: The company to which the webshop belongs, e.g. 'Derendinger-Switzerland'.

parameters.name: articleId
parameters.description: Path parameter of id of requested article.

200.description: Successful response provides the requested article information.

400.description: If the provided company name is invalid, the service responds with a 400 (Bad Request) status.

404.description: If the article with given id does not exist, the service responds with a 404 (Not Found) status.

get.description: Retrieves representation of a list of article stocks, which are given by their ids.

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: The company to which the webshop belongs, e.g. 'Derendinger-Switzerland'.

parameters.name: articleIds
parameters.description: Query parameter containing comma-separated list of identifiers of articles. The article identifiers must be positive integer values consisting of max 10 digits.

parameters.name: branchId
parameters.description: Query parameter containing identifier of a branch.

200.description: Successful response provides a list of article stocks representations.

400.description: If the provided company name is invalid, the list of article identifier is empty, or any article identifier does not conform to the identified rules, then the service responds with a 400 (Bad Request) status.

get.description: Retrieves representation of a list of article stocks, which are given by their ids.

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: The company to which the webshop belongs, e.g. 'Derendinger-Switzerland'.

parameters.name: articleIds
parameters.description: Query parameter containing comma-separated list of identifiers of articles. The article identifiers must be positive integer values consisting of max 10 digits.

parameters.name: branchId
parameters.description: Query parameter containing identifier of a branch.

200.description: Successful response provides a list of article stocks representations.

400.description: If the provided company name is invalid, the list of article identifier is empty, or any article identifier does not conform to the identified rules, then the service responds with a 400 (Bad Request) status.

get.description: Retrieves representation of a list of articles sum of stocks for the requested country, which are given by their ids.

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: The company to which the webshop belongs, e.g. 'Derendinger-Switzerland'.

parameters.name: articleIds
parameters.description: Query parameter containing comma-separated list of identifiers of articles. The article identifiers must be positive integer values consisting of max 10 digits.

200.description: Successful response provides a list of article stocks sum representations.

400.description: If the provided company name is invalid, the list of article identifier is empty, or any article identifier does not conform to the identified rules, then the service responds with a 400 (Bad Request) status.

get.description: Retrieves the quantity on stock of a certain article which is given by its id.

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: The company to which the webshop belongs, e.g. 'Derendinger-Switzerland'.

parameters.name: articleId
parameters.description: Path parameter of id of requested article.

parameters.name: branchId
parameters.description: Query parameter containing identifier of a branch.

200.description: Successful response returns the quantity on stock.

schema.description: The currently available quantity of requested article.

400.description: If the provided company name is invalid, the service responds with a 400 (Bad Request) status and an ErrorInfo object.

404.description: If the article with given id does not exist, the service responds with a 404 (Not Found) status.

post.description: Requests prices of a list of articles from ERP system.

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: The company to which the webshop belongs, e.g. 'Derendinger-Switzerland'.

parameters.name: priceRequest
parameters.description: The request contains a list of items, which contain articles with quantities.

400.description: If the provided company name is invalid, the service responds with a 400 (Bad Request) status and an ErrorInfo object. + If the request entity contained in message body violates any validation rule, the resulting status will also be 400 (Bad Request), but responds with a detailled description of violated rules instead of an ErrorInfo object.

post.description: Requests availabilities of a list of articles from ERP system.

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: The company to which the webshop belongs, e.g. 'Derendinger-Switzerland'.

400.description: If the provided company name is invalid, the service responds with a 400 (Bad Request) status and an ErrorInfo object. + If the request entity contained in message body violates any validation rule, the resulting status will also be 400 (Bad Request), but responds with a detailled description of violated rules instead of an ErrorInfo object.

post.description: Requests stock information for a list of articles from SAG vendors

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: The company to which the webshop belongs, e.g. 'Derendinger-Switzerland'.

parameters.name: vendorId
parameters.description: The vendorID to which the request will be sent

400.description: If the request entity contained in message body violates any validation rule, the resulting status will also be 400 (Bad Request), but responds  with a detailled description of violated rules instead of an ErrorInfo object.

get.description: Requests vendor information for a list of articles

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: The company to which the webshop belongs, e.g. 'Derendinger-Switzerland'.

parameters.name: articleIds
parameters.description: Query parameter containing a list of identifiers of comma-seperated articles

400.description: If the request entity contained in message body violates any validation rule, the resulting status will also be 400 (Bad Request), but responds  with a detailled description of violated rules instead of an ErrorInfo object.

post.description: Requests forwarding of (new) order to ERP system, so that it can be manually post-processed by ERP users.

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: The company to which the webshop belongs, e.g.'Derendinger-Switzerland'.

parameters.name: orderRequest
parameters.description: The request containing the shopping basket for which an order is expected to be created.

200.description: If provided shopping basket passes business validation rules and ERP ensures fulfillment the order based on basket, the response will be 200 (OK).

400.description: If the provided company name is invalid, the service responds with a 400 (Bad Request) status and an ErrorInfo object. + If the request entity contained in message body violates any validation rule, the resulting status will also be 400 (Bad Request), but responds with a detailled description of violated rules instead of an ErrorInfo object.

get.description: Retrieves basket history information

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: The company to which the webshop belongs, e.g.'Derendinger-Switzerland'.

parameters.name: customerRefText
parameters.description: Reference text for the header of the order which will be used in all documents e.g. invoice.

parameters.name: orderNr
parameters.description: The number of the requested order.

200.description: Successful retrieval of the history of the basket results in an HTTP status of 200 (OK).

400.description: If the provided company name is invalid, the service responds with a 400 (Bad Request) status and an ErrorInfo object. + If the request entity contained in message body violates any validation rule, the resulting status will also be 400 (Bad Request), but responds with a detailled description of violated rules instead of an ErrorInfo object.

post.description: Requests transfer of new shopping basket to the ERP system. The ERP system asynchronously creates orders based on the shopping basket, but service call immediately returns when shopping basket could be transfered.

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: The company to which the webshop belongs, e.g.'Derendinger-Switzerland'.

parameters.name: orderRequest
parameters.description: The request containing the order to be forwarded.

202.description: Successful transfer of order results in Accepted status code.

400.description: If the provided company name is invalid, the service responds with a 400 (Bad Request) status and an ErrorInfo object. + If the request entity contained in message body violates any validation rule, the resulting status will also be 400 (Bad Request), but responds with a detailled description of violated rules instead of an ErrorInfo object.

post.description: Requests change of the sales order process status.

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: The company to which the webshop belongs, e.g.'Derendinger-Switzerland'.

parameters.name: orderProcessStatus
parameters.description: The request containing the order to to have its status changed.

202.description: Successful transfer of order results in Accepted status code.

400.description: If the provided company name is invalid, the service responds with a 400 (Bad Request) status and an ErrorInfo object. + If the request entity contained in message body violates any validation rule, the resulting status will also be 400 (Bad Request), but responds with a detailled description of violated rules instead of an ErrorInfo object.

post.description: Requests transfer of new shopping basket to the ERP system. The ERP system asynchronously creates orders based on the shopping basket, but service call immediately returns when shopping basket could be transfered.

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: The company to which the webshop belongs, e.g.'Derendinger-Switzerland'.

parameters.name: updateOrderRequest
parameters.description: The request containing the order to be updated.

200.description: Successful update of order results in false error code

400.description: If the provided company name is invalid, the service responds with a 400 (Bad Request) status and an ErrorInfo object. + If the request entity contained in message body violates any validation rule, the resulting status will also be 400 (Bad Request), but responds with a detailled description of violated rules instead of an ErrorInfo object.

get.description: Retrieves representation of a list of orders for a customer.

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: The company to which the webshop belongs, e.g.'Derendinger-Switzerland'.

parameters.name: customerNr
parameters.description: The number of the customer.

parameters.name: orderNr
parameters.description: The number of the requested order.

parameters.name: dateFrom
parameters.description: The start date of range for order selection in ISO 8601 format.

parameters.name: dateTo
parameters.description: The end date of range for order selection in ISO 8601 format.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The number of the page to be retrieved, defaults to the first page. The page parameter should not be provided explicitly, but the usage of `next` and `prev` links of the response is recommended.

200.description: Successful retrieval of the orders of the customer results in an HTTP status of 200 (OK).

400.description: If the provided company name is invalid, the service responds with a 400 (Bad Request) status.

404.description: If the customer has no orders or customer does not exist, endpoint responds with a 404 (Not Found) status.

get.description: Retrieves the representation of a list of positions for an order given by its number.

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: The company to which the webshop belongs, e.g. 'Derendinger-Switzerland'.

parameters.name: customerNr
parameters.description: The number of the customer.

parameters.name: orderNr
parameters.description: The number of the order.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The number of the page to be retrieved, defaults to the first page. The page parameter should not be provided explicitly, but the usage of `next` and `prev` links of the response is recommended.

200.description: Successful response returns the entire list of positions of given order.

400.description: If the provided company name is invalid, the service responds with a 400 (Bad Request) status.

404.description: If the order given by its number does not exist, the service endpoint responds with a 404 (Not Found) status.

get.description: Retrieves the representation of a particular order position, which is given by the number of the order and the sequence number of the position.

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: The company to which the webshop belongs, e.g. 'Derendinger-Switzerland'.

parameters.name: customerNr
parameters.description: The number of the customer.

parameters.name: orderNr
parameters.description: The number of the order.

parameters.name: sequence
parameters.description: the id of the position

200.description: Succesful response returns the representation of the position specified by the parameters.

400.description: If the provided company name is invalid, the service responds with a 400 (Bad Request) status.

404.description: If the order position referenced by number of order and sequence number does not exist, the service endpoint responds with a 404 (Not Found) status.

get.description: Retrieves url that points to the pdf of the given deliveryNote nr.

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: The company to which the webshop belongs, e.g. 'Derendinger-Switzerland'.

parameters.name: customerNr
parameters.description: Path parameter of the number of the customer.

parameters.name: deliveryNoteNr
parameters.description: Path parameter of nr of requested deliveryNote.

200.description: Successful response provides the requested url.

400.description: If the provided company name is invalid, the service responds with a 400 (Bad Request) status.

404.description: If the deliveryNote with given nr does not exist, the service responds with a 404 (Not Found) status.

post.description: Provides functionality to create a return order and post it.

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: The company to which the webshop belongs, e.g.'Derendinger-Switzerland'.

parameters.name: returnOrderRequest
parameters.description: The request containing the return order to be created

200.description: Successful transfer of return order results

400.description: If the provided company name is invalid, the service responds with a 400 (Bad Request) status and an ErrorInfo object. + If the request entity contained in message body violates any validation rule, the resulting status will also be 400 (Bad Request), but responds with a detailled description of violated rules instead of an ErrorInfo object.

get.description: Retrieves the representation of a list of transaction references for a given parameter

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: The company to which the webshop belongs, e.g. 'Derendinger-Switzerland'.

parameters.name: reference
parameters.description: The value of this parameter can refer to orderNr or deliveryNoteNr or invoiceNr or transaction Id

200.description: Successful response returns the entire list of transaction references for given search criteria

400.description: If the provided company name is invalid, the service responds with a 400 (Bad Request) status.

404.description: If the transaction references given by the search criteria do not exist, the service endpoint responds with a 404 (Not Found) status.

get.description: Retrieves employee representation.

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: The company to which the webshop belongs, e.g. 'Derendinger-Switzerland'.

parameters.name: searchName
parameters.description: The search name of the employee.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the employee.

parameters.name: telephoneNr
parameters.description: The telephone number of the employee.

parameters.name: emailAddress
parameters.description: The email address number of the employee.

200.description: Successful response if employee could be retreived in the context of the company.

400.description: If the provided company name is invalid, the service responds with a 400 (Bad Request) status.

404.description: If the queried employee does not exist, the service responds with a 404 (NotFound) status.

get.description: Retrieves employee representation by employee personal number.

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: The company to which the webshop belongs, e.g. 'Derendinger-Switzerland'.

parameters.name: personalNr
parameters.description: The personal number of the employee.

200.description: Successful response if employee with the given number could be retreived in the context of the company.

400.description: If the provided company name is invalid, the service responds with a 400 (Bad Request) status.

404.description: If employee with given number does not exist, the service responds with a 404 (NotFound) status.

get.description: Retrieves warehouses information

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: The company to which the webshop belongs, e.g. 'Derendinger-Switzerland'.

200.description: Successful response if branches could be retreived in the context of the company.

400.description: If the provided company name is invalid, the service responds with a 400 (Bad Request) status.

post.description: Retrieves next working day of a specific warehouse

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: The company to which the webshop belongs, e.g. 'Derendinger-Switzerland'

200.description: Successful response if next working date could be retreived in the context of the company.

400.description: If the provided company name is invalid, the service responds with a 400 (Bad Request) status.

get.description: Retrieves representation of a warehouse which is given by its id.

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: The company to which the webshop belongs, e.g. 'Derendinger-Switzerland'.

parameters.name: branchId
parameters.description: Path parameter of id of requested warehouse.

200.description: Successful response provides the requested warehouse information.

400.description: If the provided company name is invalid, the service responds with a 400 (Bad Request) status.

404.description: If the branch with given id does not exist, the service responds with a 404 (Not Found) status.

get.description: Retrieves representation of a list of electronic delivery notes for a customer.  At least one query must be used, the `dateFrom`. If query parameter `dateTo` is missing then today's date is implied.

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: The company to which the webshop belongs, e.g.'Derendinger-Switzerland'.

parameters.name: customerNr
parameters.description: Path parameter of the number of the customer.

parameters.name: dateFrom
parameters.description: The start date of range for electronic delivery notes selection in ISO 8601 format.

parameters.name: dateTo
parameters.description: The end date of range for electronic delivery notes selection in ISO 8601 format.

200.description: Successful retrieval of the electronic delivery notes of the customer results in an HTTP status of 200 (OK)

400.description: If the provided company name is invalid, the service responds with a 400 (Bad Request) status.

404.description: If the customer has no electronic delivery notes or customer does not exist, endpoint responds with a 404 (Not Found) status.

get.description: Retrieves representation of an invoice which is given by its id.

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: The company to which the webshop belongs, e.g. 'Derendinger-Switzerland'.

parameters.name: customerNr
parameters.description: Path parameter of the number of the customer.

parameters.name: invoiceId
parameters.description: Path parameter of id of requested invoice.

200.description: Successful response provides the requested invoice information.

400.description: If the provided company name is invalid, the service responds with a 400 (Bad Request) status.

404.description: If the invoice with given id does not exist, the service responds with a 404 (Not Found) status.

get.description: Retrieves representation of a list of invoices for a customer.  At least one query must be used, and the dateFrom/dateTo parameters, should be used as a pair, with a date span of 31 days.

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: The company to which the webshop belongs, e.g.'Derendinger-Switzerland'.

parameters.name: customerNr
parameters.description: Path parameter of the number of the customer.

parameters.name: dateFrom
parameters.description: The start date of range for invoice selection in ISO 8601 format.

parameters.name: dateTo
parameters.description: The end date of range for invoice selection in ISO 8601 format.

parameters.name: orderNr
parameters.description: An order number of the invoice.

parameters.name: packingSlipNr
parameters.description: A packing slip number of the invoice.

200.description: Successful retrieval of the invoices of the customer results in an HTTP status of 200 (OK)

400.description: If the provided company name is invalid, the service responds with a 400 (Bad Request) status.

404.description: If the customer has no invoices or customer does not exist, endpoint responds with a 404 (Not Found) status.

get.description: Retrieves url that points to the pdf of the given invoice nr.

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: The company to which the webshop belongs, e.g. 'Derendinger-Switzerland'.

parameters.name: customerNr
parameters.description: Path parameter of the number of the customer.

parameters.name: invoiceNr
parameters.description: Path parameter of nr of requested invoice.

200.description: Successful response provides the requested url.

400.description: If the provided company name is invalid, the service responds with a 400 (Bad Request) status.

404.description: If the invoice with given nr does not exist, the service responds with a 404 (Not Found) status.

get.description: Retrieves the representation of a list of positions for an invoice given by its number.

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: The company to which the webshop belongs, e.g. 'Derendinger-Switzerland'.

parameters.name: customerNr
parameters.description: The number of the customer.

parameters.name: invoiceNr
parameters.description: The number of the invoice.

parameters.name: orderNr
parameters.description: An order number of the invoice.

parameters.name: packingSlipNr
parameters.description: A packing slip number of the invoice.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The number of the page to be retrieved, defaults to the first page. The page parameter should not be provided explicitly, but the usage of `next` and `prev` links of the response is recommended.

200.description: Successful response returns the entire list of positions of given invoice.

400.description: If the provided company name is invalid, the service responds with a 400 (Bad Request) status.

404.description: If the invoice given by its number does not exist, the service endpoint responds with a 404 (Not Found) status.

get.description: Retrieves the representation of a list of positions for an invoice given by its number.

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: The company to which the webshop belongs, e.g. 'Derendinger-Switzerland'.

parameters.name: customerNr
parameters.description: The number of the customer.

parameters.name: invoiceNr
parameters.description: The number of the invoice.

parameters.name: sequence
parameters.description: The sequence number of the position in the invoice.

parameters.name: orderNr
parameters.description: An order number of the invoice.

200.description: Successful response returns the entire list of positions of given invoice.

400.description: If the provided company name is invalid, the service responds with a 400 (Bad Request) status.

404.description: If the invoice given by its number does not exist, the service endpoint responds with a 404 (Not Found) status.

get.description: Retrieves the representation of a list of positions for a list of invoices given by their number.

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: The company to which the webshop belongs, e.g. 'Derendinger-Switzerland'.

parameters.name: customerNr
parameters.description: The number of the customer.

parameters.name: invoiceNrs
parameters.description: A list of invoice numbers seperated by comma

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The number of the page to be retrieved, defaults to the first page. The page parameter should not be provided explicitly, but the usage of `next` and `prev` links of the response is recommended.

200.description: Successful response returns the entire list of positions of given invoice.

400.description: If the provided company name is invalid, the service responds with a 400 (Bad Request) status.

404.description: If the invoices given by their number donot exist, the service endpoint responds with a 404 (Not Found) status.

post.description: Creates an offer in the Ax ERP.

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: The company to which the webshop belongs, e.g.'Derendinger-Switzerland'.

parameters.name: orderRequest
parameters.description: The request containing the shopping basket for which an offer is expected to be created.

200.description: If provided shopping basket passes business validation rules and ERP ensures fulfillment the order based on basket, the response will be 200 (OK).

400.description: If the provided company name is invalid, the service responds with a 400 (Bad Request) status and an ErrorInfo object. + If the request entity contained in message body violates any validation rule, the resulting status will also be 400 (Bad Request), but responds with a detailled description of violated rules instead of an ErrorInfo object.

get.description: Retrieves representation of a warehouse which is given by its id

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: The company to which the webshop belongs, e.g.'Derendinger-Switzerland'.

parameters.name: operatingUnitNr
parameters.description: Operating unit number

200.description: Successful response returns the operation unit entity

400.description: If the provided company name is invalid, the service responds with a 400 (Bad Request) status and an ErrorInfo object. + If the request entity contained in message body violates any validation rule, the resulting status will also be 400 (Bad Request), but responds with a detailled description of violated rules instead of an ErrorInfo object.

get.description: Public endpoint returns release, build and version information of running service. This public endpoint is the only one, that is not protected any security measurement, and can therefore used as health-check by any monitoring application.

200.description: Successful response provides release information.

get.description: Retrieves representation of a used credit card for a customer.

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: The company to which the webshop belongs, e.g.'Derendinger-Switzerland'.

parameters.name: customerNr
parameters.description: The number of the customer.

parameters.name: UsedCreditLimitPaymentMethod
parameters.description: The payment method, enum.

200.description: Successful retrieval of the used credit limit of the customer results in an HTTP status of 200 (OK).

400.description: If the provided company name is invalid, the service responds with a 400 (Bad Request) status.

404.description: If the customer has no used credit limit or customer does not exist, endpoint responds with a 404 (Not Found) status.

releaseBuild.description: The build number of released service application.

releaseVersion.description: The version of released service application according to version control system.

releaseDate.description: The date and time the service application has been built and released.

errorMessage.description: Description of the error that occured.

defaultBranchId.description: The default branch of the customer.

language.description: ISO code of language, which is preferred by the customer. This language should be provided in subsequent request for this customer. The language is then expected to be provided in `Accept-Language` HTTP header.

addressSalutation.description: The personal title of a customer.

blockedStatus.description: Enumeration value of the blocking status of customer.

blockedReason.description: Description of reason for blocked customer.

currency.description: ISO code of currency for invoicing the customer.

sendMethod.description: The `sendMethod` describes, how goods are usually delivered to the customer.

invoiceType.description: Short description of how the customer gets invoiced.

invoiceTypeDesc.description: Description of how the customer gets invoiced.

letterCode.description: The letter code of the customer

salesGroup.description: The Sales Group of the customer.

costCenter.description: The cost center which the customer belongs to.

kuKa.description: The category of the customer (under PKZ_BAUM hierarchy - KuKas_DD/ KuKas_MA)

salesRepPersonalNumber.description: The Sales Reps Personal Number of the customers Sales Group.

termOfPayment.description: The payment terms for the customer.

cashDiscount.description: The cash discount for the customer.

disposalNumber.description: The customer with this disposer number doesn't pay for recycling fees for the recyclable articles.

collaborationEDI.description: Indicates the participation of the customer in the EDI.

invoiceAccount.description: The invoice account of the customer.

gwsDupCustCompleteInvoicing.description: Indicates whether the customer has complete invoicing

gwsInvoiceSumBy.description: Indicates how the invoice is sum

sagGwsLimitedTimeDlvTermExpiryDate.description: The limited time delivery term expiry date

sagGwsPriceDiscDetailsForNetPricingPacki.description: Indicates if there are price discount details for net on pricing packing slip

sagGwsPrintPricesOnSalesPackingSlip.description: Indicates whether the prices on sales are printed on packing slip

sagGwsExcludeFromShipmentConsolidation.description: Indicates whether customer is excluded from shipment consolidation

sagGwsSuppressPrintOfRecommendedPrice.description: Indicates whether there is suppress print of recommended price

sagPriceTypeSelectionEnabled.description: Indicates whether price type selection is enabled

sagGwsPriceDiscDetailsForNetPricingCalcP.description: The price discount details for net pricing calculated in price presentaion

_links.description:
Map of links, which makes URIs to other resources available through symbolic names. The following table lists possible mappings: +
 +
 **self (GET)**: The link to article representation itself. Following this link returns representation of very same article resource. +
 +
 **collection/addresses (GET)**: Following this link with a GET request, results in a list of all addresses of the customer. +
 +
 **collection/orders (GET, POST)**: Following this link with a GET request, results in a list of all orders of the customer. In order to create a new order, a POST request must be sent to this URI. +
 +
 **collection/prices (POST)**: Article prices for customer can be retrieved by submitting a POST request to this URI. The request message contains the list of articles, for which prices are required. +
 +
 **collection/availabilities (POST)**: Availability of articles for requesting customer can be retrieved by submitting a POST request to this URI. The request message contains the list of articles, for which article availabilities are required. +
 +
 **collection/invoices (GET)**: Following this link with a GET request, results in a list of the invoices of the customer. +   
 +
 **collection/creditlimit (GET)**: Following this link with a GET request, results in the credit limit info of the customer. +

contactType.description: The type of the contact of the customer

isPrimary.description: Indicator whether the contact is the primary one of the customer

id.description:
Id of the address. Although, identifiers usually not returned "as is" to calling Webshop application, this exceptional case is justified, because the
 'address id' must be passed back with availability request.

postCode.description: Post code of address, AKA zip code.

countryCode.description: ISO code of the country of the address.

country.description: Multi-language name of the country. Is this required???? Do webshop applications rather use countryCode and their own translations????

active.description: Boolean indicator for address being active.

addressType.description: Enumeration value for type (or role) of address. While one and the same address can appear in different roles, the type distinguish them.

buildingCompliment.description: Additional address related information on the address's building.

description.description: A dercription of the purpoce of the returned address.

_links.description:
Map of links, which makes URIs to other resources available through symbolic names. The following table lists possible links: +
 +
 **self (GET)**: The link to address representation itself. Following this link returns representation of very same address resource. +
 +
 **next-tour (GET)**: Following this link, the next planned delivery tour to this address will be returned. Start date/time can be provided as query parameter, so that only tours departing from warehouse/distribution center after or equal that given start date/time will be considered. Current date/time will be used when query parameter is missing.

addresses.description: The list of addresses is embedded in this resource representation.

_links.description:
Map of links, which makes URIs to other resources available through symbolic names. The following table lists possible links: +
 +
 **self (GET)**: The link to representation of list of addresses itself. Following this link returns representation of very same list of addresses.

tourName.description: A string of format X_Y_Z where X is the starting point of the tour, Y is the Description (tour number), Z is the time(HH:mm).

startTime.description:
Point in time when tour starts at distribution center. +
 +
 **Note 1**: This isn't the point in time when customer's delivery address is reached, because that time is actually not predictable.

keyword.description: Search term of article in SAG-sys.

salesQuantity.description: Unit of consumption, i.e. number of units to be sold (SAG speech for 'Verbrauchseinheit').

depotArticleId.description: Leading article id of related depot article, if there is any; null otherwise.

recycleArticleId.description: Leading article id of related recycle article,if there is any;null otherwise

vocArticleId.description: Leading article id of related voc article, if there is any; null otherwise.

vrgArticleId.description: Leading article id of related vrg article, if there is any; null otherwise.

articleLock.description: Indicator for article being locked at an Umsart level or with Absolute ArtikelSperre

fitmentLock.description: Indicator for article being locked for front-end applications

_links.description:
Map of links, which makes URIs to other resources available through symbolic names. The following table lists possible links: +
 +
 **self (GET)**: The link to article representation itself. Following this link returns representation of very same article resource.
 +
 **collection/stock (GET)**: Following this link with a GET request, results in a list of the article stock per branch. +

Map of links, which makes URIs to other resources available through symbolic names. The following table lists possible mappings: +
 +
 **self (GET)**: The link to the article response representation itself. Following this link returns the very same response representation.
 +
 **collection/stocks (GET)**: Following this link with a GET request, results in a list of articles stocks per branch. +
 +
 **collection/stocks/sum (GET)**: Following this link with a GET request, results in a list of articles sum of stocks for the requested country. +

articleStock.description: List of results of article stocks.

_links.description:
Map of links, which makes URIs to other resources available through symbolic names. The following table lists possible mappings: +
 +
 **self (GET)**: The link to the article stock response representation itself. Following this link returns the very same response representation.

articleStockSum.description: List of results of article total stocks.

_links.description:
Map of links, which makes URIs to other resources available through symbolic names. The following table lists possible mappings: +
 +
 **self (GET)**: The link to the article stock sum response representation itself. Following this link returns the very same response representation.

stock.description: The quantity of the article which is currently on stock.

branchId.description: The id of the branch of the article for which stock is requested.

_links.description:
Map of links, which makes URIs to other resources available through symbolic names. The following table lists possible links: +
 +
 **self (GET)**: The link to article representation itself. Following this link returns representation of very same article resource.

articleId.description: The id of requested article stock.

stockSum.description: The total quantity of the article, in the requested country, which is currently on stock.

_links.description:
Map of links, which makes URIs to other resources available through symbolic names. The following table lists possible links: +
 +
 **self (GET)**: The link to article representation itself. Following this link returns representation of very same article resource.

articleId.description: The id of requested article stock.

customerNr.description: The number of the customer the price are request for.

calculateAssortedQtyDisc.description: Indicates whether the assorted quantity discounts shall be recalculated or not.

items.description: List of article positions for which prices are requested.

articleId.description: The id of the article to get a price for.

quantity.description: Requested quantity of article, which need to be greater than zero.

currency.description: The currency of all resulting prices.

grossPrice.description: The gross price of a single unit of the article before applying any discount.

netPrice.description: The net price of a single unit of the article before applying any discount.

discountPrice.description: The discount for a single unit of the article.

totalGrossPrice.description: The total gross price for the total number of unit of the requested article before applying any discount.

totalNetPrice.description: The total net price for the total number of unit of the requested article before applying any discount.

totalDiscountPrice.description: The total discount amount for requested articles.

discountInPercent.description: The discount percentage for requested articles.

errorMessage.description: Message in case we have error response from ERP.

priceFound.description: Indicates if a price has been found at the ERP.

hasAssortedQtyDisc.description: Indicates whether an assorted quantity discount exists for the current item or not.

unitOfMeasurement.description: The id of the unit for the specified quantity.

priceValue.description: The additional price of a single unit of the article before applying any discount.

customerNr.description: The number of the customer the article availabilities are request for.

sendMethod.description: The method of delivering the goods

partialDelivery.description: Flag indicating the desire of `availabilityRequestItem`s being delivered separately, in case they have different `arrivalTime`.

deliveryAddressId.description: The id of the address where the listed goods should be delivered.

pickupBranchId.description: Id of the warehouse where the customer will pick up the articles from, in case `sendMethod` is PICKUP. For PICKUP with no branchId, the default of customer will be used.

pickingWarehouse.description: Id of the warehouse where the articles will be picked for the Tour. Thus, the `sendMethod` is obvious that it should be TOUR. If the field is omitted  service behaves as usual.

isTourTimetable.description: Flag indicating if there will be a calculation for the creation of Tour timetable. Default value is false

items.description: List of article positions for which availabilities are requested.

articleId.description: The id of the article to be checked for availability.

quantity.description: Requested quantity of article, which need to be greater than zero.

backOrder.description: Attribute indicating whether the requested quantity is not available and SAG needs to place a back order in order to fulfill.

sendMethod.description: Send method denotes how goods are usually delivered to the customer.

assignmentPriority.description: Assignment priority of split line -- filled only in split lines

errorMessage.description: Message in case we have error response from ERP.

tourName.description: A string of format X_Y_Z where X is the starting point of the tour, Y is the Description (tour number), Z is the time(HH:mm)

tourTimeTable.description: A list of Tours from the current querying date and time until the current querying time of the next working day

nextWorkingDate.description: Next working date of the given branch

_links.description:
Map of links, which makes URIs to other resources available through symbolic names. The following table lists possible links: +
 +
 **branch (GET)**: Following this link results the branch for which the next working 
 date was calculated

branchId.description: Id of the warehouse for which the next working date will be calculated

date.description: The date from which the calculation for the next working date begins. Format should be ISO8601

alreadyUsedCredit.description: Credit that is already used by customer

type.description: The id of the sales order category.

typeDesc.description: The description of the sales order category.

sendMethod.description: The mode of the delivery of the ordered goods.

status.description: The status of the sales order.

_links.description:
Map of links, which makes URIs to other resources available through symbolic names. The following table lists possible links: +
 +
 **collection/positions (GET)**: Following this link results in a list of all positions of this order.

Map of links, which makes URIs to other resources available through symbolic names. The following table lists possible mappings: +
 +
 **self (GET)**: The link to list of orders representation itself. Following this link returns the very same order list representation. +
 +
 **next (GET)**: The `next` link is present, if older orders than returned ones exist. This link repeats query parameters, which are provided in original request. That way, clients do not need to construct URIs themselves to get the batch of next orders. +
 +
 **prev (GET)**: The `prev` link is present, if more recent orders than returned ones exit. This link repeats query parameters, which are provided in original request. That way, clients don't need to construct URIs themselves to get the batch of previous orders.

sequence.description: Sequence number of position in order.

articleId.description:
Id of article. Basic article information can also retrieved by following the articles link. +
 +
 Note: Usually, returning identifiers from services is avoided, but the id of an article should through the catalog data have a meaning for a webshop application.

_links.description:
Map of links, which makes URIs to other resources available through symbolic names. The following table lists possible links: +
 +
 **self (GET)**: The link to this order position representation itself. Following this link returns representation of very same order position resource. +
 +
 **article (GET)**: Following this link leads to the article resource, this order position belongs to.

Map of links, which makes URIs to other resources available through symbolic names. The following table lists possible links: +
 +
 **self (GET)**: The link to order positions representation itself. Following this link returns representation of very same list of order positions.
 +
 **next (GET)**: The `next` link is present, if older order positions than returned ones exist. This link repeats query parameters, which are provided in original request. That way, clients do not need to construct URIs themselves to get the batch of next order positions. +
 +
 **prev (GET)**: The `prev` link is present, if more recent order postitions than returned ones exit. This link repeats query parameters, which are provided in original request. That way, clients don't need to construct URIs themselves to get the batch of previous order positions.

orderPositions.description: The list of order positions is embedded in this resource representation.

customerNr.description: The number of the ordering customer

partialDelivery.description: Flag indicating the desire of `orderItem`s being delivered separately, in case they have different`arrivalTime`.

deliveryAddressId.description: The id of the address where the `orderItems` will be delivered to.

pickupBranchId.description: The id of the store where the customer will pick up the articles from, in case `sendMethod` is PICKUP. For PICKUP with no branchId, the default of customer will be used.

customerRefText.description: Reference text for the header of the order which will be used in all documents e.g. invoice.

message.description: Message to a real-person processor of the order. If a message is placed, the order cannot be created until a seller handles it manually.

orderType.description: The id of the sales order category

items.description: List of items that are requested to be ordered.

articleId.description: The id of the article to be ordered.

quantity.description: Requested quantity of article, which need to be greater than zero.

arrivalTime.description: The arrival time in ISO 8601 format

externalLineNumber.description: External line number for identifying each position

additionalTextDoc.description: Additional text which will be included in the position and will be printed in documents, e.g. offer or invoice selected by `additionalTextDocPrinters`.

additionalTextDocPrinters.description: The id of the printer which is logged in the text management

registrationDocNr.description: The number of the official document that comes along with a (new) car from the producer containing all the relevant technical details, serial numbers etc.

orderNr.description: The number of the order which the process status will be changed.

processStatus.description: The order process status to change to.

orderNr.description: Reserved number of the order that will be created asynchronously. The order cannot be retrieved immediately, the time to actual creation cannot be predicted. Since there is no notification mechanism, polling for the order is the only way to check for the order be actually created.

axOrderURL.description: A query string which can be attached to an AX URL in order to access the  created sales order in ERP.

workIds.description: A list of workIds of the work that was creates in case that the new sales order has a process status change and the Release to Warehouse and Wave processing was automatically done due to the process status change.

allPositionsAvailable.description: Indicates that all lines are directly available from any warehouse. If there are lines that are not available the resulting sales order might not be processed automatically.

creditLimitExceeded.description: Indicates if the customers credit limit is exceeded. The shopping cart is created nevertheless, but the resulting sales order might not be processed automatically.

_links.description:
Map of links, which makes URIs to other resources available through symbolic names. The following table lists possible links: +
 +
 **order (GET)**: The link to the order which is waiting to be created.

processStatusChanged.description: Inticates a successful order process status change.

personalNumber.description: The personal number of the employee.

searchName.description: The search name of the employee.

_links.description:
Map of links, which makes URIs to other resources available through symbolic names. The following table lists possible links: +
 +
 **self (GET)**: The link to employee representation itself. Following this link returns representation of very same employee resource.

employees.description: The list of employees is embedded in this resource representation.

_links.description:
Map of links, which makes URIs to other resources available through symbolic names. The following table lists possible links: +
 +
 **self (GET)**: The link to employees representation itself. Following this link returns representation of very same list of employees.

Map of links, which makes URIs to other resources available through symbolic names. The following table lists possible links: +
 +
 **self (GET)**: The link to branch representation itself. Following this link returns representation of very same branch

branches.description: The list of branches is embedded in this resource representation.

_links.description:
Map of links, which makes URIs to other resources available through symbolic names. The following table lists possible links: +
 +
 **self (GET)**: The link to branches representation itself. Following this link returns representation of very same list of branches.

articleName.description: The article description in the current language of the item id.

EAN.description: European Article Number or EAN which is a standard describing a barcode symbology and numbering system used in global trade to identify a specific retail product type.

currency.description: ISO code of currency for invoicing the customer.

customerArticleId.description: The article identifier of the customer.

manufacturerArticleId.description: The article identifier of the manufacturer.

netPrice.description: The net price of a single unit of the article before applying any discount.

createdDate.description: The created date time of the electronic delivery note.

lineInvoiceAmount.description: The amount of articles of the invoice position.

return.description: Denotes if this packing slip is a return or a delivery.

referenceFactor.description: The total value of the invoice.

electronicDeliveryNotes.description: The list of electronic delivery notes is embedded in this resource representation.

_links.description:
Map of links, which makes URIs to other resources available through symbolic names. The following table lists possible links: +
 +
 **self (GET)**: The link to electronic delivery notes representation itself. Following this link returns representation of very same list of electronic delivery notes.

amount.description: The total value of the invoice.

paymentType.description: The type of payment of the random order linked to the invoice. An invoice can have positions from more than one orders.

_links.description:
Map of links which makes URIs to other resources available through symbolic names. The following table lists possible links: +
 +
 **self (GET)**: The link to invoice representation itself. Following this link returns representation of very same invoice list representation.

invoices.description: The list of invoices is embedded in this resource representation.

_links.description:
Map of links, which makes URIs to other resources available through symbolic names. The following table lists possible links: +
 +
 **self (GET)**: The link to invoices representation itself. Following this link returns representation of very same list of invoices.

articleId.description: The article identification of the invoice position.

quantity.description: The amount of articles of the invoice position.

orderNr.description: The corresponding order identification for the invoice position.

invoiceNr.description: The invoice identification of the invoice position.

deliveryNoteNr.description: The delivery note identification of the invoice position.

amount.description: The value of the invoice position.

sequence.description: The sequence number of the position in the invoice.

_links.description:
Map of links which makes URIs to other resources available through symbolic names. The following table lists possible links: +
 +
 **self (GET)**: The link to invoice representation itself. Following this link returns representation of the very same invoice position representation. +

invoicePositions.description: The list of invoice positions is embedded in this resource representation.

_links.description:
Map of links, which makes URIs to other resources available through symbolic names. The following table lists possible links: +
 +
 **self (GET)**: The link to invoice positions representation itself. Following this link returns representation of the very same list of invoice positions.
 +
 **next (GET)**: The `next` link is present, if older invoice positions than returned ones exist. This link repeats query parameters, which are provided in original request. That way, clients do not need to construct URIs themselves to get the batch of next invoice positions. +
 +
 **prev (GET)**: The `prev` link is present, if more recent order postitions than returned ones exit. This link repeats query parameters, which are provided in original request. That way, clients don't need to construct URIs themselves to get the batch of previous invoice positions.

axOfferURL.description: A query string which can be attached to an AX URL in order to access the  created sales offer in ERP.

id.description: The electronic location Id of operationg unit

contacts.description: The list of contacts for the operating unit

orderUrl.description: Part of the Url to call the return order details page directly for the created return order

quarantineOrder.description: True if the given return order is a quarantine return order

returnOrderUrl.description: Part of the Url to call the positions directly for the created return order

transId.description: Lot id of the source sales order

isQuarantine.description: True, if the created return order position should be marked as quarantine

quarantineReason.description: Reason why the item is marked as quarantine. Free Text. Mandatory if isQuarantine is true

returnReasonCodeId.description: Optional return reason code id, if not set default from return order name will be used

branchId.description: The id of the warehouse. If not set, the invent location from current worker will be used -- one of branchId and personalNumber must be set

personalNumber.description: The Sales Reps Personal Number of the Customers Sales Group. Will be used as current worker -- one of branchId and personalNumber must be set

returnOrderName.description: Defines the record for default values from return order name table.

returnOrderDocumentConfirmationPrint.description: True, if return order receive confirmation document should be printed. If not set or false no document will be printed.

articleId.description: The Item Id of the transaction reference

articleName.description: The article description in the current language of the item id

orderNr.description: Releated order nr found for the given search string

customerNr.description: Customer account of the found position

branchId.description: Original location of point of sell

sourcingType.description: Sourcing type when sales line has a sourcing type set

vendorArticleId.description: The vendor id of the article

vendors.description: List of vendors for a given article id

externalLineNumber.description: External line number for identifying each position

baskets.description: The history of basket records that correspond to the given criteria

customerRefText.description: Reference text for the header of the order which will be used in all documents e.g. invoice.

courierServices.description: The list of courier services is embedded in this resource representation.
